data.title: Jiangsu Ruitai New Energy Materials Co., Ltd. Reports Earnings Results for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Jiangsu Ruitai New Energy Materials Co., Ltd. reported earnings results for the nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the nine months, the company reported sales was CNY 1,481.98 million compared to CNY 1,606.13 million a year ago. Revenue was CNY 1,481.98 million compared to CNY 1,606.13 million a year ago.

Net income was CNY 117.83 million compared to CNY 149.49 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.16 compared to CNY 0.2 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was CNY 0.16 compared to CNY 0.2 a year ago.

Blue Owl profit rises on strong performance across credit, real assets platforms
data.description:
(Reuters) -Alternative asset manager Blue Owl Capital reported a rise in third-quarter profit on Thursday, driven by strong performance across its credit and real assets platforms.

Blue Owl's real assets platform includes a net-lease investment strategy focused on single-tenant, free-standing properties, along with a digital infrastructure strategy centered on data centers and a real estate credit business.

Asset managers have posted strong results this quarter, buoyed by rising markets and renewed fundraising momentum across both private and public strategies.

Robust performance in credit, in particular, is likely to ease investor concerns about broader industry stress that surfaced after the collapse of auto parts maker First Brands.

Blue Owl's assets under management rose 26% in the third quarter to $295.6 billion.

"New capital commitments reached $14 billion in the third quarter and $57 billion over the last twelve months, highlighting strong interest in our strategies across institutional, private wealth, and insurance clients," said Doug Ostrover and Marc Lipschultz, co-CEOs of Blue Owl.

Blue Owl's credit platform saw assets under management increase 18% to $152.1 billion. Direct lending originations were $10.9 billion with net deployment of $2.9 billion.

Investor demand for private credit has continued despite recent worries, as borrowers increasingly turn to direct lenders for flexible financing amid tighter conditions in traditional loan markets.

Alternative asset managers invest in non-traditional assets such as private credit, real estate and infrastructure, catering to institutional and wealthy clients seeking higher returns and diversification beyond public markets.

On an adjusted basis, Blue Owl's fee-related earnings per share rose to 24 cents in the three months ended September 30, compared with 22 cents a year earlier.

Adjusted distributable earnings were 22 cents apiece in the quarter versus 20 cents in the year-ago period.

Analysts on average had expected 22 cents, according to estimates compiled by LSEG.

Shares of Blue Owl were last down 0.2% in premarket trading after results.

(Reporting by Manya Saini in Bengaluru; Editing by Krishna Chandra Eluri)

PetroChina's third-quarter net profit down 3.9% year-on-year
data.description:
(Reuters) -Asia's largest oil and gas producer PetroChina Co Ltd reported on Thursday a 3.9% year-on-year decline in third-quarter net profit due to lower oil prices as it maintained steady crude production and expanded natural gas output.

Net profit fell to 42.29 billion yuan ($5.94 billion), the company said in a stock filing, while revenue rose 2.3% to 719.16 billion yuan.

Domestic peer offshore oil and gas producer CNOOC Ltd reported on Thursday a 12% fall in quarterly earnings, while refining giant Sinopec Corp posted on Wednesday flat net income for the same period.

In the first nine months of this year, PetroChina produced 714.3 million barrels of oil, 0.8% higher year-on-year, including 591.3 million barrels, or 82.8%, produced domestically.

Natural gas output expanded 4.6% year-on-year to 3,977.2 billion cubic feet during the nine months, 97% of which was produced in China.

Crude oil processing at PetroChina, which is also China's second-largest refiner after Sinopec, was up 0.4% at 1,040.6 million barrels, or 3.81 million barrels per day during the nine-month period.

Sales of gasoline, diesel and jet fuel rose 0.8% year-on-year to 120.9 million metric tons, reversing a 4.6% fall in the same period in 2024. Of that, domestic sales stood flat at 89.64 million tons.

Aviation fuel expanded 13.2% and diesel was up 0.3%. Gasoline sales, however, fell 2.6% owing to competition from electric vehicles.

The company said it continued to strengthen exploration and development with a focus on increasing reserves and production, while pushing ahead with upgrading its refining and chemicals business.

In renewables, it generated 5.79 billion kilowatt hours of electricity from wind and solar in the January-September period, up 72% year on year.

Its natural gas sales in the first three quarters rose 4.2% to 218.5 billion cubic meters (bcm), including 171 bcm sold domestically.

The nine-month capital spending totalled 177.2 billion yuan, versus 180.2 billion yuan a year earlier.

PetroChina's Hong Kong-listed shares have risen 30.4% year-to-date, slightly lagging a 31% rise in the Hang Seng index.

($1 = 7.1230 Chinese yuan renminbi)

(Reporting by Sam Li and Chen Aizhu; Editing by Susan Fenton)

By Sam Li and Chen Aizhu
